prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Chief Attorney at Fey & Co.. My boss, and a very good defense attorney.
Character 1
Name: Larry Butz
Description: The defendant in this case. A likeable guy who was my friend in grade school.
Character 2
Name: Cindy Stone
Description: The victim in this case. A model, she lived in an apartment by herself.
Character 3
Name: Winston Payne
Description: The prosecutor for this case. Lacks presence. Generally bad at getting his points across.
Character 4
Name: Frank Sahwit
Description: Discovered Ms. Stone's body. Newspaper salesman who saw Larry flee the scene.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Cindy's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 7/31, 4PM-5PM. Cause of death: loss of blood due to blunt trauma.
Evidence 2
Name: Statue
Description: A statue in the shape of "The Thinker". It's rather heavy.
Evidence 3
Name: Passport
Description: The victim apparently arrived home from Paris on 7/30, the day before the murder.
Evidence 4
Name: Blackout Record
Description: Electricity to Ms. Stone's building was out from noon to 6 PM on the day of the crime.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was going door-to-door, selling subscriptions when I saw a man fleeing an apartment.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 1
Testimony: I thought he must be in a hurry because he left the door half-open behind him.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 2
Testimony: Thinking it strange, I looked inside the apartment.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 3
Testimony: Then I saw her lying there... A woman... not moving... dead!
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 4
Testimony: I quailed in fright and found myself unable to go inside.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 5
Testimony: I thought to call the police immediately!
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 6
Testimony: However, the phone in her apartment wasn't working.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 7
Testimony: I went to a nearby park and found a public phone.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 8
Testimony: I remember the time exactly: It was 1:00 PM.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 9
Testimony: The man who ran was, without a doubt, the defendant sitting right over there.
Person: Sahwit

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot: The contradiction lies between Evidence 4 (Blackout Record), which states that the electricity to Ms. Stone's building was out from noon to 6 PM on the day of the crime, and Testimony 8, where Sahwit claims to remember the exact time as 1:00 PM when he saw a man fleeing the apartment. If there was a blackout, the lighting would have been out, casting doubt on Sahwit's ability to clearly identify the man at 1:00 PM.

Characters:
Character 0

Description: Chief Attorney at Fey & Co.. My boss, and a very good defense attorney.
Character 1
Name: Larry Butz
Description: The defendant in this case. A likeable guy who was my friend in grade school.
Character 2
Name: Cindy Stone
Description: The victim in this case. A model, she lived in an apartment by herself.
Character 3
Name: Winston Payne
Description: The prosecutor for this case. Lacks presence. Generally bad at getting his points across.
Character 4
Name: Frank Sahwit
Description: Discovered Ms. Stone's body. Newspaper salesman who saw Larry flee the scene.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Cindy's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 7/31, 4PM-5PM. Cause of death: loss of blood due to blunt trauma.
Evidence 2
Name: Statue
Description: A statue in the shape of "The Thinker". It's rather heavy.
Evidence 3
Name: Passport
Description: The victim apparently arrived home from Paris on 7/30, the day before the murder.
Evidence 4
Name: Blackout Record
Description: Electricity to Ms. Stone's building was out from noon to 6 PM on the day of the crime.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: You see, when I found the body, I heard the time.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 1
Testimony: There was a voice saying the time... It was probably coming from the television.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 2
Testimony: Oh, but it was three hours off, wasn't it?
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 3
Testimony: I guess the victim must have been watching a video of a taped program!
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 4
Testimony: That's why I thought it was 1:00 PM!
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 5
Testimony: Terribly sorry about the misunderstanding...
Person: Sahwit

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 4 states that the electricity to Ms. Stone's building was out from noon to 6 PM on the day of the crime. This implies that no television would have been working during that time.

However, Testimonies 0, 1, 2, 3, and 4 from Sahwit indicate that he heard a voice saying the time, which he believed was coming from the television. They discuss the time on the television and an error in the clock shown on the TV.

If the electricity was out, the television would not have been on to provide the voice saying the time that Sahwit heard. This is a contradiction between the evidence of the blackout and Sahwit's testimony about hearing the time from the television.

Selecting one pair that clearly contradict:

Evidence 4 (Blackout Record) versus Testimony 1 (Sahwit's claim about the time being from the television).

Characters:

Character 2
Name: Cindy Stone
Description: The victim in this case. A model, she lived in an apartment by herself.
Character 3
Name: Winston Payne
Description: The prosecutor for this case. Lacks presence. Generally bad at getting his points across.
Character 4
Name: Frank Sahwit
Description: Discovered Ms. Stone's body. Newspaper salesman who saw Larry flee the scene.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Cindy's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 7/31, 4PM-5PM. Cause of death: loss of blood due to blunt trauma.

Evidence 4
Name: Blackout Record

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Actually, I didn't "hear" the time... I "saw" it!
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 1
Testimony: There was a table clock in the apartment, wasn't there!
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 2
Testimony: Yeah, the murder weapon! The killer used it to hit the victim!
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 3
Testimony: That must have been what I saw.
Person: Sahwit

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot: Evidence 4 states that the electricity to Ms. Stone's building was out from noon to 6 PM on the day of the crime, meaning that there would have been no functioning electric clocks during this period. Testimony 0, by Sahwit, indicates that he "saw" the time, implying he saw a clock showing the time rather than hearing it. However, if the electricity was out, a table clock that relied on electricity would not have been working, making it unlikely that Sahwit could visually confirm the time as he claims.
